text: Frank Frederick Borman II (March 14, 1928 - November 7, 2023) was an American astronaut and the commander of Apollo 8. He received a Bachelor of Science at West Point and a Master of Science in Aeronautical Engineering at the California Institute of Technology. Apollo 8 was the first mission to fly around the Moon. The other members of Apollo 8 were Jim Lovell and Bill Anders. After leaving NASA, he was the chief executive officer (CEO) of Eastern Air Lines from 1975 to 1986.NASA bio Borman was a recipient of the Congressional Space Medal of Honor. Borman died on November 7, 2023 of a stroke in Billings, Montana at the age of 95. ==References== ==More readings== * Category:American astronauts Category:Apollo astronauts Category:1928 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Scientists from Indiana Category:Scientists from Tucson, Arizona Category:People from Gary, Indiana Category:Time People of the Year
title: Frank Borman
